metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Git GitHub Flow
Change Platform:
What is the GitHub Flow?
The GitHub Flow is a simple, effective workflow for collaborating on code using Git and GitHub.
content.html: The GitHub Flow is a simple, effective workflow for collaborating on code using Git and GitHub.

content.text: It helps teams work together smoothly, experiment safely, and deliver new features or fixes quickly.
content.html: It helps teams work together smoothly, experiment safely, and deliver new features or fixes quickly.

content.text: Here's how the GitHub Flow works, step by step:
content.html: Here's how the GitHub Flow works, step by step:

content.text: This workflow is designed to be easy for beginners and powerful for teams of any size.
content.html: This workflow is designed to be easy for beginners and powerful for teams of any size.

content.text: Create a New Branch
Branching is the key concept in Git. And it works around the rule that the master branch is ALWAYS deployable.
content.html: Branching is the key concept in Git. And it works around the rule that the master branch is ALWAYS deployable.

content.text: That means, if you want to try something new or experiment, you create a new branch!
content.html: That means, if you want to try something new or experiment, you create a new branch!

content.text: Branching gives you an environment where you can make changes without affecting the main branch.
content.html: Branching gives you an environment where you can make changes without affecting the main branch.

content.text: When your new branch is ready, it can be reviewed, discussed, and merged with the main branch when ready.
content.html: When your new branch is ready, it can be reviewed, discussed, and merged with the main branch when ready.

content.text: When you make a new branch, you will (almost always) want to make it from the master branch.
content.html: When you make a new branch, you will (almost always) want to make it from the master branch.

content.text: Note: Keep in mind that you are working with others.
content.html: Note: Keep in mind that you are working with others.

content.text: Using descriptive names for new branches, so everyone can understand what is happening.
content.html: Using descriptive names for new branches, so everyone can understand what is happening.

content.text: Make Changes and Add Commits
After the new branch is created, it is time to get to work.
content.html: After the new branch is created, it is time to get to work.

content.text: Make changes by adding, editing and deleting files.
content.html: Make changes by adding, editing and deleting files.

content.text: Whenever you reach a small milestone, add the changes to your branch by commit.
content.html: Whenever you reach a small milestone, add the changes to your branch by commit.

content.text: Adding commits keeps track of your work.
content.html: Adding commits keeps track of your work.

content.text: Each commit should have a message explaining what has changed and why.
content.html: Each commit should have a message explaining what has changed and why.

content.text: Each commit becomes a part of the history of the branch, and a point you can revert back to if you need to.
content.html: Each commit becomes a part of the history of the branch, and a point you can revert back to if you need to.

content.text: Note: commit messages are very important! Let everyone know what has changed and why.
content.html: Note: commit messages are very important! Let everyone know what has changed and why.

content.text: Messages and comments make it so much easier for yourself and other people to keep track of changes.
content.html: Messages and comments make it so much easier for yourself and other people to keep track of changes.

content.text: Open a Pull Request
Pull requests are a key part of GitHub.
content.html: Pull requests are a key part of GitHub.

content.text: A Pull Request notifies people you have changes ready for them to consider or review.
content.html: A Pull Request notifies people you have changes ready for them to consider or review.

content.text: You can ask others to review your changes or pull your contribution and merge it into their branch.
content.html: You can ask others to review your changes or pull your contribution and merge it into their branch.

content.text: Review
When a Pull Request is made, it can be reviewed by whoever has the proper access to the branch.
content.html: When a Pull Request is made, it can be reviewed by whoever has the proper access to the branch.

content.text: This is where good discussions and review of the changes happen.
content.html: This is where good discussions and review of the changes happen.

content.text: Pull Requests are designed to allow people to work together easily and produce better results together!
content.html: Pull Requests are designed to allow people to work together easily and produce better results together!

content.text: If you receive feedback and continue to improve your changes, you can push your changes with new commits, making further reviews possible.
content.html: If you receive feedback and continue to improve your changes, you can push your changes with new commits, making further reviews possible.

content.text: Note: GitHub shows new commit and feedback in the "unified Pull Request view".
content.html: Note: GitHub shows new commit and feedback in the "unified Pull Request view".

content.text: Deploy
When the pull request has been reviewed and everything looks good, it is time for the final testing.
content.html: When the pull request has been reviewed and everything looks good, it is time for the final testing.

content.text: GitHub allows you to deploy from a branch for final testing in production before merging with the master branch.
content.html: GitHub allows you to deploy from a branch for final testing in production before merging with the master branch.

content.text: If any issues arise, you can undo the changes by deploying the master branch into production again!
content.html: If any issues arise, you can undo the changes by deploying the master branch into production again!

content.text: Note: Teams often have dedicated testing environments used for deploying branches.
content.html: Note: Teams often have dedicated testing environments used for deploying branches.

content.text: Merge
After exhaustive testing, you can merge the code into the master branch!
content.html: After exhaustive testing, you can merge the code into the master branch!

content.text: Pull Requests keep records of changes to your code, and if you commented and named changes well, you can go back and understand why changes and decisions were made.
content.html: Pull Requests keep records of changes to your code, and if you commented and named changes well, you can go back and understand why changes and decisions were made.

content.text: Note: You can add keywords to your pull request for easier searching!
content.html: Note: You can add keywords to your pull request for easier searching!
